meanings.definition: A knight renowned for heroism and chivalry.
meanings.sent1: The paladin bravely rescued the princess from the dragon.
meanings.sent2: The paladin's shining armor reflected the sunlight as he rode into battle.
meanings.sent3: The paladin's code of honor forbade him from fleeing even in the face of danger.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as her paladin, always ready to defend her honor.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the paladin's unwavering courage inspired all who fought alongside him.

meanings.definition: A champion or advocate of a cause.
meanings.sent1: As a paladin of justice, he fought tirelessly for the rights of the oppressed.
meanings.sent2: The environmental paladin led the campaign to protect the endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The paladin of truth always spoke up against lies and deceit.
meanings.sent4: She was a paladin for education, believing it was the key to a better future.
meanings.sent5: The paladin of equality worked to ensure that everyone had a fair chance in society.

meanings.sent1: To the young boy, his father was a paladin of strength and wisdom.
meanings.sent2: The legendary warrior was seen as a paladin of the people, fighting for their freedom.
meanings.sent3: In the eyes of the villagers, the doctor was a paladin of healing, curing all ailments.
meanings.sent4: She became a paladin of hope, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The artist was considered a paladin of creativity, pushing boundaries with every masterpiece.
